description:
Castellaniella denitrificans is a species of bacteria that belongs to the phylum Proteobacteria, class Betaproteobacteria, and order Burkholderiales. It is a Gram-negative, aerobic, and motile bacterium.

Castellaniella denitrificans is capable of denitrification, which is the process of converting nitrate or nitrite to gaseous nitrogen compounds, such as nitric oxide (NO), nitrous oxide (N2O), or dinitrogen (N2). This metabolic process allows the bacterium to use nitrate or nitrite as alternative electron acceptors when oxygen is limited or absent.

The cells of Castellaniella denitrificans are typically rod-shaped and can form cysts or spore-like structures under certain environmental conditions. The bacterium is found in various soil and aquatic environments, and it has been isolated from sources such as activated sludge, river sediments, and contaminated groundwater.

Castellaniella denitrificans is known to play a role in the nitrogen cycle and can contribute to the removal of nitrate or nitrite from environments where they may be present as pollutants. Its denitrification capabilities have been studied for potential applications in wastewater treatment and bioremediation processes.
